tuv.seg: Food safety and food poisoning
Sábháilteacht agus nimhiú bia
If you suspect that you have food poisoning, it is important that you contact or visit your family doctor (GP)
Má cheapann tú go bhfuil nimhiú bia ort tá sé tábhachtach go dtéann tú i dteagmháil le, nó go dtéann tú go dtí do dhochtúir
Food poisoning symptoms can occur days after you have eaten contaminated food
D'fhéadfadh na comharthaí a theacht chun solais laethanta tar éis duit an bia truaillithe a ithe
Symptoms of food poisoning usually include one or more of the following:
De ghnáth bíonn ceann ar a laghad de na comharthaí seo a leanas san áireamh:
You should always report a confirmed food poisoning illness to your Local Health Office or the Food Safety Auhority of Ireland (FSAI)
Ba cheart duit breoiteacht dheimhnithe de nimhiú bia a chur in iúl do d’Oifig Sláinte Áitiúil nó d’Údarás Sábháilteachta Bia na hÉireann (ÚSBÉ)
If other people report illness associated with similar products or outlets, your report will help highlight the precise numbers of people affected
Má dhéanann daoine eile tuairisc faoi thinneas atá baint aige le táirgí nó asraonta cosúla, cabhróidh do thuairisc le chur chun suntais an méid daoine atá ag goilleadh
This will also permit the public health doctors and environmental health officers to identify problems
Ligeann sé seo do dhochtúirí sláinte poiblí agus oifigigh sláinte comhshaoil fadhbanna a aithint
Your vigilance in pointing out a problem can prevent others becoming seriously ill
Má tharraingíonn tú aird ar an bhfadhb, d'fhéadfá daoine eile a chosaint ón tinneas
If you have eaten or bought food that is not safe or of a satisfactory standard, you have the right to make a formal complaint
Má tá tú tar éis bia a ithe nó a cheannach nach bhfuil sábháilte, nó nach sroicheann caighdeán sásúil, tá an ceart agat gearán foirmeálta a dhéanamh
Food is considered unsafe/unsatisfactory when it:
Glactar leis nach bhfuil bia sábháilte má:
• Results in you experiencing vomiting, diarrhoea or stomach pains
• fhaigheann tú pianta boilg, buinneach, nó má chuireann tú amach mar gheall air
• Contains a foreign object, for example, glass, insects, hair
• tá ábhar iasachta ann, mar shampla gloine, feithid, gruaig
• Is contaminated by chemicals such as disinfectants or detergents
• tá sé truaillithe ag ceimicí cosúil le díghalrán nó glantach
• Appears to be contaminated in some way - this may be noticed by a bad taste or smell
• tá an chosúlacht air go bhfuil sé truaillithe i gcaoi éigin - d'fhéadfá é seo a thabhairt faoi deara mar gheall ar dhrochbhlas nó boladh
In addition, you can also make a complaint if you are unhappy with the hygiene standard in a food premises, e.g., supermarket, restaurant, etc
Chomh maith leis sin, d'fhéadfá gearán a dhéanamh má tá tú míshásta leis an gcaighdeán glaineachta in áitreabh bia, mar shampla ollmhargadh, bialann agus araile
If you suspect that there is something wrong with the food you have been served or purchased
Má cheapann tú go bhfuil rud éigin mícheart leis an mbia a tugadh duit nó a cheannaigh tú
• Do not accept an unsatisfactory meal in a restaurant or café – send it back, leave or ask for an entirely fresh serving on a clean plate
• Ná glac le béile nach bhfuil sásúil i mbialann nó caifé - tabhair ar ais é, fág an áit, nó déan iarratas ar chuid úr ar phláta glan
• Always remember that hot food must be served piping hot
• Ná déan dearmad go gcaithfidh bia te a bheith te agus é á chur chun boird
Store the affected food in a sealed container in the fridge until it is examined by the authorities
Stóráil an bia a ndearnadh dochar dó i gcoimeádán séalaithe sa chuisneoir go dtí go ndéanann na húdaráis scrúdú air
• Make a note of when and where the food was purchased, when the food was first opened and when the problem was first noticed
• Scríobh nóta faoi cén uair agus cén ait ar ceannaíodh an bia, cén uair ar osclaíodh é don chéad uair, agus cén uair ar tugadh faoi deara go raibh fadhb ag baint leis don chéad uair
• Keep the food product in the fridge or freezer, cover it and store it away from other food
• Coinnigh an táirge bia sa chuisneoir nó sa reoiteoir, cuir clúdach air, agus coinnigh in áit ar leith é ionas nach mbeidh sé i dteagmháil le bia eile
• Do not remove any foreign objects from the food product
• Ná bhain aon ábhar iasachta den táirge bia
• Keep all the labels and packaging from the food product
• Coinnigh na lipéid agus an phacáistíocht ón táirge bia
Analysis of food samples
Anailísiú ar shamplaí bia
The Public Analyst Laboratory provides analysis of food samples if there is a complaint
Soláthraíonn Saotharlann an Anailísí Phoiblí anailís ar shamplaí bia má dhéantar gearán
There is no charge for this if a food complaint is submitted through the Environmental Health Service Offices
Níl aon táille air seo má dhéantar gearán faoi bhia trí na hOifigí Seirbhísí Sláinte Comhshaoil
There is a fee for food sample analysis if you submit samples directly to the laboratory
Féadfaidh tú samplaí a sheoladh go díreach chuig an tsaotharlann ach gearrtar táille, sa chás sin, ar anailís a dhéanamh ar shampla bia
If you have a complaint regarding food or a food premises, you should contact the Environmental Health Officer in your Local Health Office or the Food Safety Authority of Ireland as soon as possible
Má tá gearán agat maidir le bia nó áitreabh bia, ba cheart duit dul i dteagmháil leis an Oifigeach Sláinte Comhshaoil i d'Oifig Sláinte Áitiúil chomh luath agus is féidir
If you submit a food complaint, the unfit food may be sent to the Public Analyst Laboratory in your region for analysis and you will be notified of the result
Má dhéanann tú gearán faoi bhia, d'fhéadfaí an bia mífholláin a chur chuig an Saotharlann Anailísí Poiblí i do cheantar le haghaidh anailisiú, agus cuirfear ar an eolas tú faoin toradh
On the other hand, you can have suspect food analysed independently by contacting your local Public Analyst Laboratory yourself
Ar an taobh eile den phingin, féadtar anailís neamhspleách a dhéanamh ar bhia a bhfuil tú in amhras air, trí theagmháil a dhéanamh, tú féin, le Saotharlann an Anailísí Phoiblí áitiúil
